0.label: Dragon-Blooded
0.description: Non-magical heat and fire do not harm you, and when you use Zuko Style, on a 10+, the flame will persist a short time without fuel.

1.label: Touch of the Infernal
1.description: When you summon fire with any of your moves, you may replace it with the black fires of hell itself. This fire does not burn with heat and ignores armor, scorching the soul itself. Creatures without souls cannot be harmed by this type of flame.

2.label: Phoenix Soul
2.description: When you go out in a blaze of glory and would take your Last Breath, the flames intervene on your behalf; you return to life with 1d6 HP and with something inherent and valuable to you sacrificed to the flames; the GM will say what.

0.label: Firebrand
0.description: Spread a dangerous new idea.

1.label: Destruction
1.description: Utterly obliterate something significant or meaningful (not necessarily a physical object).

2.label: Torment
2.description: Freely sacrifice of yourself to bring about a good result.

0.label: Arcane Student
0.description:
Add the following option to the 7-9 list for Cast a Spell:
- You need to consume magical reagents to power your magic, describe them and spend 1 use of Supplies.

1.label: Natural Gift
1.description: Describe the heritage of yours that makes you naturally inclined to magic, and choose one option from the Cantrip list. You can create that effect whenever you like, without having to Cast a Spell.

2.label: Blood Mage
2.description: When you shed your blood while Casting a Spell, you lose HP equal to the lower of the two dice rolled, ignoring armor, and on a hit, your spell gets +1 Power.

0.label: Power
0.description: Use your magic to command the respect of others or enhance your prestige.

1.label: Knowledge
1.description: Discover something about a magical mystery.

2.label: Weird
2.description: Confront or embrace something strange or other-worldly.

2.label: If You Chose Dagger, You Also Get...

0.label: Outrider
0.description:
When you Scout Ahead, choose one more option, even on a miss, and add the following to the questions you can ask by spending a pick from Scout Ahead:
- Where could I best hide or blend in around here?
- Where’s my best way in, out, or through this place?
- What can I see that no one else can see?

1.label: Wilderness Guide
1.description: You can always find your way back to a place you have been to before without Defying Danger from getting lost or any natural rough terrain, and you can make a map of any place you have been or explored with ease. When you lead the way while Undertaking a Perilous Journey, choose an extra benefit from the list; even on a miss you still choose a benefit.

2.label: Warden of Nature
2.description:
When you Spout Lore about a monster, you roll with WIS instead of INT.

Additionally, choose a favorite type of enemy such as dragons, giants, goblin-kin, or demons: ___________

Add the following to the list of questions for Skirmisher:
- Am I fighting my favorite type of enemy?

0.label: Wildling
0.description: Eschew a convention of the civilized world.

1.label: Naturalist
1.description: Help an animal or spirit of the wild.

2.label: Sentinel
2.description: Endanger yourself to combat an unnatural threat.

0.label: Burglar
0.description: When you Discern Realities or use Danger Sense, you may ask the GM "What here is useful or valuable to me?" for free, even on a miss.

1.label: Assassin
1.description:
Add the following to the list of options for Backstab:
- You temporarily disable one of their limbs or senses

Additionally, when you Backstab, on a 10+ you get three choices from the list instead of two.

2.label: Street Rat
2.description: When you blend into a crowd or the shadows, enemies never spot you until you draw attention to yourself or leave your cover.

0.label: Treasure Hunter
0.description: Take a major risk to acquire something valuable.

1.label: Infiltrator
1.description: Infiltrate a secure or dangerous location.

2.label: Daredevil
2.description: Leap into danger without a plan.

2.label: If You Chose Dagger, You Also Get...

0.label: Loremaster
0.description: When you use Bardic Lore, on a 10+ you may also ask the GM an additional follow-up question about the subject, they will answer truthfully.

1.label: Blade-Singer
1.description: When you use Vox Arcanus, on a 10+, if your next action is to Hack and Slash, you gain advantage when you make your Hack and Slash roll.

2.label: Courtier
2.description: When you Parley, on a 10+, you may also ask them one question, which they must answer truthfully. This information comes from a slip of the tongue or their body language giving it away; they won't notice that they gave up their information.

0.label: Fellowship
0.description: Use your art to help those in need.

1.label: Adventure
1.description: Spur Others to significant and decisive action.

2.label: Diplomacy
2.description: Avoid a conflict or defuse a tense situation.

2.label: If You Chose a Ragged Bow, You Also Get...

0.label: Banneret
0.description: When you raise your voice, it carries far and cuts through even the din of heavy battle for all to hear. When you Recruit, add your CHA to the roll, and any followers you recruit start with +1 Loyalty.

1.label: Sacred Guardian
1.description: When you Defend, you do not need to spend hold to redirect an attack from the thing you Defend to yourself; you can do it for free.

2.label: Fanatical Crusader
2.description: When you pray for guidance, even for a moment, and ask, “What here is evil?” the GM will tell you honestly.

0.label: Chivalry
0.description: Endanger yourself to defend those weaker than you.

1.label: Judgement
1.description: Deny mercy to a criminal or unbeliever.

2.label: Crusade
2.description: Lead others in righteous battle.

0.label: Far Traveler
0.description:
When you lead the way while you Undertake a Perilous Journey or Defy a Danger caused by the natural environment, you may describe how you have dealt with a similar trouble in your journeys before; if you do, gain advantage to your roll.

Additionally, when you Spout Lore about your homeland or its traditions, you cannot get a 6-, treat any such result as a 7-9 instead.

1.label: Beast-kin
1.description: Your heritage includes the blood of a beast or a monster. Describe your species and appearance! You begin with three Heritage moves and three Heritage boxes, and at the start of each session (including the first one), you mark two Heritage boxes instead of one. (refer to the Heritage mechanic in the rules).

2.label: Vandal
2.description:
Your people know only war and violence. When you Discern Realities, on a hit you may also ask "What here is weak or vulnerable?" for free.

Additionally, when you prove yourself superior to someone in power, gain advantage on your next move made against their followers, underlings, and hangers-on.

0.label: Exile
0.description: Teach someone the ways of your people and learn about them in exchange.

1.label: Honor
1.description: Uphold your personal code of honor despite the cost or inconvenience.

2.label: Conquest
2.description: Prove yourself superior to someone in power.

0.label: Theologian
0.description: When you Spout Lore or perform First Aid, you add your WIS to the roll instead of your INT.

1.label: Militant Order
1.description: You ignore the clumsy tag on armor you wear, and any armor you wear, not including shields, has -2 weight, to a minimum of zero.

2.label: Miracle Worker
2.description:
When you fulfill your deity's Demands, record that (does not stack).

When you or an ally suffers harm, you may erase that mark to call on your deity, who intervenes with an appropriate manifestation and negates the harm; describe what happens!

0.label: Pilgrim
0.description: Bring the light of your faith to a new place or people and leave them better for it.

1.label: Evangelist
1.description: Prove the superiority of your church or god.

2.label: Shepherd
2.description: Endanger yourself to help another.

0.label: Keeper of the Old Faith
0.description: When you Make Camp, you may make the First Aid move once without spending Supplies, and when you do so, you may cure your subject of a debility, poison or disease afflicting them instead of recovering HP or stabilizing their wounds.

1.label: Spirit-Touched
1.description:
You were born with your Tell showing plainly for all to see. Choose an animal you can Shapeshift into based upon your choice of land and relevant to your Tell. When you Shapeshift into that animal, you get +1 Nature, even on a miss.

Additionally, when you Parley with the spirits of your chosen Land, your roll gains advantage.

2.label: Wildling
2.description: When you mark an animal (with mud, dirt, or blood), you can see through that animal’s eyes as if they were your own, no matter what distance separates you. Only one animal at a time may be marked in this way. This doesn’t give you control over the animal, but they could be convinced to do as you say by Parleying with them.

0.label: Renewal
0.description: Reclaim something for the natural world.

1.label: Cultivation
1.description: Help something or someone grow or move on to the next step in the cycle.

2.label: Preservation
2.description: Eliminate an unnatural menace.

0.label: Military Veteran
0.description: When you Spout Lore about a military unit or combat situation, you may describe a similar situation you have faced before; if you do, you roll with STR instead of INT. The first person acting on your information gains advantage on their next move that follows. Additionally, when an enemy is watching you and there’s a difficult choice to make, the GM will tell you what the enemy expects you to do.

1.label: Battle Master
1.description: When you prepare yourself for battle (through careful strategizing, tranquil meditation, or otherwise), the next time you enter a battle, you gain 2 Focus instead of 1.

2.label: Intimidating Brute
2.description: When you make threats of violence while you Parley, you roll with STR instead of CHA.

0.label: Guardian
0.description: Endanger yourself to defend those weaker than you.

1.label: Warlord
1.description: Prove yourself in battle against a worthy opponent.

2.label: Champion
2.description: Choose honor over personal gain.

3.label: If You Chose a Dagger, You Also Get...
